metadata.feature_description: Group similar activities together in the stream

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify grouped activities are displayed in stream

steps.action: Navigate to Community page with Activity Stream
steps.expected: Activity Stream should be displayed with activities
steps.actual: Activity Stream displayed with multiple activity entries including grouped badge activities

steps.action: Scroll to locate grouped activity entry
steps.expected: Grouped activities should show consolidated view with count of similar activities
steps.actual: Found grouped activity: 'Test User11 received the badge Getting started' with '10 others also received the badge' - showing similar activities are grouped together

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Expand grouped activities to view all participants

steps.action: Click on '10 others' link in the grouped badge activity
steps.expected: A popup or expanded view should show all users who performed the same activity
steps.actual: Popup dialog titled 'Received the badge' appeared showing all 14 users (Test User11, Test User10, Test User09, etc.) who received the same badge with their avatars and profile links

steps.action: Verify grouped activity count is accurate
steps.expected: The count should match the actual number of grouped activities
steps.actual: The popup showed 14 users total which matches the displayed '10 others' (3 avatars visible + 10 others + 1 main user = 14 users)

observations: Activity Stream Grouping is enabled by default in the module settings (EnableGrouping setting)
The grouping feature consolidates similar activities (like multiple users earning the same badge) into a single stream entry
Grouped entries display up to 3 user avatars plus a '10 others' link for additional users
Clicking the 'X others' link opens a GroupedJournalControl popup that lists all users who performed the same activity
Each user in the expanded view has a clickable profile link
